bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Home Missionary Society was a multi-denominational organization founded in 1841 to provide financial support to congregations around the Philadelphia area and to spread the gospel to the destitute. The Philadelphia Home Missionary Society was an auxiliary to the American Home Missionary Society.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the executive committee of the Philadelphia Home Missionary Society, 1853-1882. The volume includes election of officers, records of the dissemination of funds for support of clergy in various churches in Pennsylvania, and requests for aid. The volume also includes minutes from the Society's annual meetings, a brief history of the Society and its relationship with the American Home Missionary Society, and an extract from the will of Mary Fassitt.
